step_by_step.explanation: Matter is anything that has mass and occupies space.

problems.final_answer: Matter: anything with mass and volume.

problems.problem: List the three classical states of matter.

step_by_step.explanation: Solids have definite shape and volume, and particles are closely packed with limited movement.

problems.final_answer: Solids: definite shape/volume, tightly packed particles.

step_by_step.explanation: Liquids have definite volume but take the shape of their container; particles can move past each other.

problems.final_answer: Liquids: definite volume, shape conforms to container.

step_by_step.explanation: Gases have neither definite shape nor definite volume; particles move freely and expand to fill the container.

problems.final_answer: Gases: no fixed shape/volume, expand to fill container.

problems.problem: Explain the difference between physical and chemical properties.

step_by_step.explanation: Characteristics observed without changing the substance, e.g., color, melting point, density.
Characteristics observed when the substance undergoes a chemical change, e.g., flammability, reactivity.

problems.final_answer: Physical: observed without changing substance; Chemical: observed during chemical change.

problems.problem: Define density and provide its formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Density is the mass per unit volume of a substance.

problems.problem: Explain what is meant by compressibility in gases.

step_by_step.explanation: Compressibility is the ability of a gas to decrease in volume when pressure is applied.

problems.final_answer: Compressibility: gas volume decreases under pressure.

problems.problem: Explain why solids are incompressible compared to gases.

step_by_step.explanation: Particles in solids are tightly packed with little space, so applying pressure does not significantly reduce volume.

problems.final_answer: Solids incompressible: particles tightly packed, minimal space.

problems.problem: Describe the phase changes from solid → liquid → gas.

step_by_step.explanation: Melting: solid absorbs heat to become liquid.
Vaporization/boiling: liquid absorbs heat to become gas.

problems.final_answer: Melting: solid → liquid; Vaporization: liquid → gas.
